paragraphs.text: Our team is passionate about our patients. We want you to get the wow factor when you arrive. We care about your smile and your well‑being, and we’ll welcome you into the Davis Orthodontics family.

We help patients achieve optimal oral health and boosted confidence. Dr. Ed Davis is a board‑certified orthodontist serving the Midlands with high‑quality, affordable care delivered in a friendly, family atmosphere.

items.title: ABO‑Certified
items.text: Dr. Ed Davis is ABO‑certified with more than 25 years of experience and active leadership in organized dentistry.

items.title: Digital Care
items.text: We use DentalMonitoring and modern digital workflows for remote scans, virtual progress reviews, and fewer in‑office visits.

items.title: Custom Orthodontics
items.text: Digital scanning and 3D planning let us personalize bracket setups and aligner plans to shorten treatment and improve comfort.

items.title: Comfort & Care
items.text: Two neighborhood offices, modern comforts, bilingual staff, and a family‑first team make each visit easy for patients of all ages.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ed Davis, Orthodontist (ABO‑Certified). With more than 25 years of clinical experience and long ties to the Midlands community, Dr. Davis leads Davis Orthodontics with a focus on life‑changing, confidence‑building smiles. He trained at the University of South Carolina and the Medical University of South Carolina and completed his orthodontic certificate at Saint Louis University. He is active in organized dentistry, serves locally in community roles, and is passionate about patient care for children and adults.

image.alt: Dr. Ed Davis, orthodontist at Davis Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: From traditional braces to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners and remote monitoring, we offer modern options to fit teens and adults.

image.alt: Patient holding clear aligner tray for aligner treatment

image.alt: Bright, welcoming orthodontic office lounge with comfortable seating

paragraphs.text: Our team at Davis Orthodontics merges art and science to create beautiful, healthy smiles. We strive to make every patient feel comfortable and relaxed in our friendly atmosphere and build strong relationships through open communication. By working together and using cutting-edge technology, we create customized treatment plans to help our patients achieve their ideal smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Ed Davis smiling, professional headshot

paragraphs.text: With over 25 years of experience and strong ties to the community, Dr. Ed Davis has become one of the most trusted orthodontists in the area. Dr. Davis is an ABO‑Certified Orthodontist who was born and raised in Columbia, South Carolina and has built a career focused on high-quality, patient-centered care.

Dr. Davis participates in state, regional, and national organized dentistry. He is a past-president of the state association and serves as national chair for AAOPAC, the advocacy committee for the American Association of Orthodontists.

image.alt: Dr. Ed Davis in clinical setting

paragraphs.text: Dr. Davis graduated from Airport High School (West Columbia), attended the University of South Carolina and the Medical University of South Carolina, and earned his Certificate in Orthodontics from Saint Louis University.

Outside of practice, Dr. Davis is active in the local community. He serves as chairman of the Springdale Zoning Board, was past chairman for East Point Academy, and supports causes such as Autism Acceptance and Awareness, Game Changers, and Make‑a‑Wish Foundation. He is a member of St. Peter’s Catholic Church, and enjoys time with his four children, two dogs, hiking, weight lifting, and movies. For a lighter side, follow his gym reels at @gymbrosdoc.

image.alt: Dr. Davis outside the office at a community event

items.name: Destiny
items.bio: Destiny began with Davis Orthodontics in 2016, moved into Treatment Coordinator in 2021 and became Office Manager in April 2023. She supports both locations and returns weekly from Greenville to stay connected. Outside work she enjoys family time and exploring the Upstate.

items.name: Cindi
items.bio: Cindi has years of dental assisting experience and fills a dual role as orthodontic assistant and scheduling coordinator. She enjoys transforming smiles and spending time with her family and dogs.

items.name: JulieAnna
items.bio: Joined the team in October 2021 with a BA in Psychology from the University of South Carolina. She enjoys fitness, 5K running, and golf.

items.name: Chapin
items.bio: Chapin manages social media, contests, events, and helps at the front desk. She studied biology at Furman and in her free time cares for rescue dogs and keeps bees.

items.name: Crystal
items.bio: With nearly 20 years’ experience, Crystal reviews scans and monitors treatment remotely as the practice's DentalMonitoring Coordinator.

items.name: Courtney
items.bio: Courtney is a skilled orthodontic assistant who supports clinical care and helps patients stay comfortable during appointments.

items.name: Emily G.
items.bio: Emily supports clinical treatment and patient care in the operatories.

items.name: Emily C.
items.bio: Emily provides chairside support and helps maintain a calm, efficient patient experience.

items.name: Hannah
items.bio: Hannah works across clinical, treatment coordination, and lab duties to keep patient care running smoothly.

items.name: Devon
items.bio: Devon supports patients through treatment planning and financial coordination, ensuring a smooth experience from first visit to retention.

slides.alt: Office waiting area with comfortable seating

paragraphs.text: Dr. Davis and Davis Orthodontics actively support local schools and community causes across the Midlands. Our practice partners with East Point Academy, advocates for Autism Acceptance and Awareness, supports Game Changers (a camp for at‑risk youth), contributes to Make‑a‑Wish Foundation, and sponsors local school programs when possible.

image.alt: Dr. Davis meeting community members at a local event

og_meta.title: About Us | Davis Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Learn about Davis Orthodontics, Dr. Ed Davis, and our team—providing patient-focused orthodontic care in West Columbia and Irmo.

image.alt: Smiling patient in an orthodontic office

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Every smile begins with an initial consultation. During your first visit you'll meet our team and receive a complete oral exam, including X-rays when needed, so we can accurately evaluate your bite and explain treatment options.

We will review your medical history, answer your questions, and create a customized treatment plan. We also discuss financial details, insurance filing, and payment options so you leave confident about next steps.

Thank you for requesting an appointment with us! Your appointment request has been received. Our friendly staff will be in touch with you shortly to confirm your appointment. We are all looking forward to welcoming you to our office!

image.alt: Welcoming orthodontic office lounge and reception

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for maximum convenience.

We also offer flexible financing through OrthoBanc to help make treatment more affordable. To access the OrthoBanc Patient Responsible Portal use this login: https://auth.orthobanc.com/account/login?returnUrl=%2Fconnect%2Fauthorize%2Fcallback%3Fclient_id%3DOrthoBanc.App.Client%26redirect_uri%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fmy.orthobanc.com%252Fsignin-oidc%26response_type%3Dcode%2520id_token%26scope%3Dopenid%2520profile%2520OrthoBanc.Services%2520offline_access%26response_mode%3Dform_post%26nonce%3D638176013640527732.MmNjMTk5NWMtMWNkZS00YTQ5LTk1NWYtZWI5MDA4M2QwYmFiMzc0OWUwYTMtNjZmNy00MjM1LWI4MWUtMzZlNWViOWMxM2Vh%26state%3DCfDJ8HDvzBixcKpKsSHtKv1H4t26v6tZODyJ9LxafnKgrnWO79PsH870rHfzPsxKRGDzFimqbtheFJjLot8navD-4oiUob5LGYyz40Gw1wLLFt6vK3NogfI152x6pWbwCjUiXFWgKgIwCa1o9wKdtKY15vojl1bMbbElolf_sqAFXzG59-geHwpFzOfXhr2Fm8pPA5M9Ojk0lgF6Lel_NeUPjFfxnlVjntM9vvgGD6R5KEw2bPl4yCCqCXcQcD_bMv3wIlm1RzPDxV6fP7NdHhQHwaAbnPjremc3urM_n4_ZKImAQKXxufEbTolsLtaaXiwyH1-lIZ8dGM1_WxAm1xX4jIE
We invite you to a complimentary consultation so we can review your goals, answer questions, and outline a clear, affordable plan for care.
To request an appointment please use our Request An Appointment page: https://dobraces.com/request-an-appointment/.

Please select a location and complete the location-specific form. Submitting a request does not guarantee an appointment; our staff will contact you to confirm your appointment or to find a better fit if necessary.

Location-specific forms include fields for name, patient type (new, transfer, current, returning), phone, email, preferred time, reason for appointment, and a simple security question. One of the form fields is intended for validation and should be left unchanged.

image.alt: Patient using a mobile device to complete new patient forms

seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, consultation, forms, financing, DO Braces

og_meta.title: Get Started | DO Braces
og_meta.description: Start your care at DO Braces: schedule an initial consultation, access new patient forms, and learn about insurance and financing options.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Davis Orthodontics, traditional metal braces remain a reliable option for children, teens, and adults. Made of stainless steel, these low-profile brackets bond to the front of teeth while wires and tiny rubber bands, called O-ties, gently guide teeth into alignment. They offer durable, cost-effective treatment and come in color options your child can customize at visits.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Damon braces use a sliding-door mechanism instead of O-ties to hold the archwire, creating a low-friction environment that can move teeth efficiently. Many patients experience fewer visits and greater comfort with this system; Dr. Davis will recommend the best bracket style for your goals and lifestyle.

Clear aligners are removable trays worn most of the day to gradually move teeth. Many patients appreciate the esthetic and lifestyle advantages: you can eat freely, brush and floss normally, and avoid most emergency visits related to brackets or wires. Treatment time varies with complexity, but aligners can address a wide range of spacing and bite concerns.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Davis Orthodontics has extensive experience with Invisalign<sup>®</sup> in our Irmo and Columbia locations. These brand-name clear aligners can correct many gapping, crowding, and bite issues. Successful treatment depends on wearing aligners as prescribed; average treatment ranges from about 6 to 12 months depending on complexity.
Follow care instructions closely, keep aligners in for the recommended time each day, and avoid hot water when cleaning to preserve fit and effectiveness.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Spark Aligners are an alternative clear-aligner system offered at Davis Orthodontics. They deliver esthetic treatment comparable to other leading aligner brands, and treatment time is generally similar to conventional aligner therapy. Dr. Davis will discuss which aligner system suits your case and goals.

DentalMonitoring pairs a ScanBox with a mobile app so our team can review weekly scans of your smile. This remote monitoring reduces in-office visits, speeds treatment in many cases, and provides real-time feedback and coaching from Dr. Davis and our coordinator.
Patients benefit from shorter treatment times, improved communication, and fewer routine office appointments while receiving consistent oversight throughout their plan.

image.alt: iTero digital scanner in use during orthodontic consultation

paragraphs.text: Retention is a lifelong process. Davis Orthodontics offers Essix, Hawley, and fixed retainers along with programs like the Retainer Club and Retention+ with DentalMonitoring to protect your results and provide replacements when needed.

Essix retainers are clear and removable, fixed retainers are bonded wires behind the teeth, and Hawley retainers use metal and acrylic. We’ll recommend the best retention plan to keep your smile stable over time.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: For complex jaw discrepancies, Dr. Davis coordinates orthodontic care with skilled oral and maxillofacial surgeons to plan and perform corrective jaw surgery. Computerized 3D planning helps minimize treatment time, improve surgical precision, and reduce recovery.

Surgery is typically performed inside the mouth to avoid visible facial scars; titanium plates and screws are used to stabilize the jaw while healing, and timelines vary by case. An experienced consultation will determine whether orthognathic surgery is recommended.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Frequently Asked Questions

accordion.header: Why should I visit an orthodontist instead of a dentist for braces?

paragraphs.text: ABO-certified orthodontists are experts in dental alignment and facial form and undergo extensive and specialized training and can provide patients with the appropriate personalized treatments.

accordion.header: When should my child have his first orthodontic screening?

paragraphs.text: According to the American Association of Orthodontics, children should have their first orthodontic screening at age 7 when several of their permanent teeth have developed.

accordion.header: Will my teeth get straighter as I get older?

paragraphs.text: No. In fact, they may become even more crooked as the teeth develop and push against one another.

accordion.header: How old is “too old” to get braces?

paragraphs.text: You are never too old for braces. Actually, one-fourth of all orthodontic patients are adults. As long as your teeth are healthy and intact, orthodontic treatment is an option!

accordion.header: Can I drop my child off for their orthodontic appointment?

paragraphs.text: In most cases, yes! Just check in with your child’s patient manager before leaving. We know your time is important. So, while we make adjustments to your child’s dental braces, you can run errands or do whatever you need to do in the meantime. When you return, we may need to speak with you about your child’s progress or treatment plan.

accordion.header: Will braces stop me from playing sports or playing an instrument?

paragraphs.text: Patients who play sports should wear a mouthguard during games and practice to avoid serious injury to their teeth, lips, and mouth. Playing an instrument may require an adjustment period, but braces will not stop you from either of these activities.

accordion.header: Should I still visit my general dentist during my orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: Regular dental check-ups and cleanings are a must and can be more necessary during orthodontic treatment. Some patients may even need to visit the dentist more frequently.

accordion.header: Do I need to brush my teeth more often with braces?

paragraphs.text: We recommend that patients with dental braces brush at least four times a day—after each meal and before going to bed. Flossing is also a must! We will show you how to do that during your initial appointment.

accordion.header: What foods should I avoid while I have orthodontic braces?

paragraphs.text: Hard, crunchy, and chewy foods can damage braces. Avoid eating things like ice, hard candy, raw vegetables, caramel, and taffy. We’ll provide you with a comprehensive list of foods to avoid so you don’t have to visit our office for repairs (due to food choices) during your treatment.
